intro: Streptanthella, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and basal rosettes of leaves. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sand dunes and rocky soils. Streptanthella species are often found in regions of the western United States and northern Mexico. They have a short life cycle and are adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
